title: Omicron Blurs Oil Outlook After Demand Roars Back
sub_head: Traders grapple with fast-spreading coronavirus variant, longer-run consumption questions
body:
The fast-spreading Omicron variant is clouding the outlook for oil markets after a rapid recovery in demand pushed prices to their highest levels in years.
Oil marched higher for much of 2021. Demand lifted as economies revved up, while producers in the Middle East and elsewhere kept millions of barrels of crude each day in the ground. Brent-crude prices, the global benchmark, climbed 53% to $79.32 a barrel.
